message.content: Multiply the first equation by $2$ and double the second equation. We get $8u-10v=46$ and $4u+8v=-16$. Adding these two equations, we find that $12u-2v=30$, so $12u=30+2v\implies u = \frac{30+2v}{12}$. To find $u+v$, we plug this value for $u$ into the first equation: \begin{align*} u+v &= \frac{30+2v}{12}+v = \frac{30+2v}{12}+\frac{12v}{12}\\ &= \frac{30+2v+12v}{12} = \frac{30+14v}{12} = \boxed{\frac{15+7v}{6}}. \end{align*}
